The following immunization clinics are open for students needing school-required immunizations. To attend one of the following clinics you must bring a copy of your student's immunization records. Cash, card, and/or insurance is needed, but it is also important to note that they will not turn away any student for the inability to pay. The cost is $20 per vaccine up to $60. Masks are required at every clinic.

KINDER KICKOFF UPDATE/CHANGE

NEWS RELEASE:
Maxine Johnson Elementary in Parma, Idaho announces our annual Kindergarten Kickoff. Parents ONLY are invited to Kinder Kickoff on Monday, August 10 at 8:00 a.m. for pre-registration. At that time there will be presentations about what to expect and a chance to sign up for screening appointments on August 21 and 24 when we will meet your incoming student.

Students must be 5 years of age by September 1, 2020 to be eligible to enroll this fall.

Parents will need to provide a state issued birth certificate and proof of immunization. If an order form for the birth certificate is needed, you may order on-line from the Bureau of Vital Statistics in the state where the child was born.

The presentations from various school personnel will be done in the multi-purpose/cafeteria to allow for appropriate social distancing.

Any questions or if you cannot come to the visit, please call the office at 779-4069, extension 2 to set up a screening appointment.

We look forward to meeting you on Monday, August 10th!!

May 18, 2020

Thank you,

Diane Hardin

Nampa Police Department
January 19 at 8:52 AM 路

** PUBLIC SAFETY ALERT ** Dangerous Drug Alert **
The Nampa Police Department would like to alert the public about a potentially dangerous drug in the community.
Officers have responded to three overdose related calls in the past two days, which we believe are connected to an illicit/illegal drug. The drug is described as a small blue pill and may be getting distributed under the premise it is OxyContin.
These drugs are extremely potent and potentially fatal. We strongly urge consumers to avoid this substance.
An investigation is being conducted related to these overdose incidents.
If you have information related to this information, please message us here on Facebook or leave a voice mail for the investigating officer at 208-475-5617.
